topics.subtitle: 단순 현재
topics.explanation: 현재 시점에서 정기적으로 또는 일반적으로 발생하는 행동을 표현할 때 사용 (Form: is/are + past participle)

examples.korean: 방은 매일 청소돼요.
examples.english: The room is cleaned every day.

examples.korean: 방은 매일 청소되지 않아요.
examples.english: The room isn't cleaned every day.

examples.korean: 방이 매일 청소돼?
examples.english: Is the room cleaned every day?

examples.korean: 방이 매일 청소되지 않아?
examples.english: Isn't the room cleaned every day?

examples.korean: 책은 도서관에서 학생들에 의해 읽혀요.
examples.english: Books are read by students in the library.

examples.korean: 책은 도서관에서 학생들에 의해 읽히지 않아요.
examples.english: Books aren't read by students in the library.

examples.korean: 책이 도서관에서 학생들에 의해 읽혀?
examples.english: Are books read by students in the library?

examples.korean: 책이 도서관에서 학생들에 의해 읽히지 않아?
examples.english: Aren't books read by students in the library?

examples.korean: 커피는 아침에 많은 사람들에 의해 마셔져요.
examples.english: Coffee is drunk by many people in the morning.

examples.korean: 커피는 아침에 많은 사람들에 의해 마셔지지 않아요.
examples.english: Coffee isn't drunk by many people in the morning.

examples.korean: 커피가 아침에 많은 사람들에 의해 마셔져?
examples.english: Is coffee drunk by many people in the morning?

examples.korean: 커피가 아침에 많은 사람들에 의해 마셔지지 않아?
examples.english: Isn't coffee drunk by many people in the morning?

examples.korean: 차는 매주 주말에 세차돼요.
examples.english: The car is washed every weekend.

examples.korean: 차는 매주 주말에 세차되지 않아요.
examples.english: The car isn't washed every weekend.

examples.korean: 차가 매주 주말에 세차돼?
examples.english: Is the car washed every weekend?

examples.korean: 차가 매주 주말에 세차되지 않아?
examples.english: Isn't the car washed every weekend?

topics.subtitle: 단순 과거
topics.explanation: 과거에 특정 시점에 완료된 행동을 표현할 때 사용 (Form: was/were + past participle)

examples.korean: 방은 어제 청소됐어요.
examples.english: The room was cleaned yesterday.

examples.korean: 방은 어제 청소되지 않았어요.
examples.english: The room wasn't cleaned yesterday.

examples.korean: 방이 어제 청소됐어?
examples.english: Was the room cleaned yesterday?

examples.korean: 방이 어제 청소되지 않았어?
examples.english: Wasn't the room cleaned yesterday?

examples.korean: 숙제는 어젯밤 아이들에 의해 완료됐어요.
examples.english: The homework was done by the kids last night.

examples.korean: 숙제는 어젯밤 아이들에 의해 완료되지 않았어요.
examples.english: The homework wasn't done by the kids last night.

examples.korean: 숙제가 어젯밤 아이들에 의해 완료됐어?
examples.english: Was the homework done by the kids last night?

examples.korean: 숙제가 어젯밤 아이들에 의해 완료되지 않았어?
examples.english: Wasn't the homework done by the kids last night?

examples.korean: 케이크는 엄마에 의해 구워졌어요.
examples.english: The cake was baked by my mom.

examples.korean: 케이크는 엄마에 의해 구워지지 않았어요.
examples.english: The cake wasn't baked by my mom.

examples.korean: 케이크가 엄마에 의해 구워졌어?
examples.english: Was the cake baked by my mom?

examples.korean: 케이크가 엄마에 의해 구워지지 않았어?
examples.english: Wasn't the cake baked by my mom?

examples.korean: 영화는 지난 주말에 우리에 의해 시청됐어요.
examples.english: The movie was watched by us last weekend.

examples.korean: 영화는 지난 주말에 우리에 의해 시청되지 않았어요.
examples.english: The movie wasn't watched by us last weekend.

examples.korean: 영화가 지난 주말에 우리에 의해 시청됐어?
examples.english: Was the movie watched by us last weekend?

examples.korean: 영화가 지난 주말에 우리에 의해 시청되지 않았어?
examples.english: Wasn't the movie watched by us last weekend?

topics.subtitle: 단순 미래
topics.explanation: 미래에 발생할 행동을 표현할 때 사용 (Form: will be + past participle)

examples.korean: 방은 내일 청소될 거예요.
examples.english: The room will be cleaned tomorrow.

examples.korean: 방은 내일 청소되지 않을 거예요.
examples.english: The room won't be cleaned tomorrow.

examples.korean: 방이 내일 청소될 거야?
examples.english: Will the room be cleaned tomorrow?

examples.korean: 방이 내일 청소되지 않을 거야?
examples.english: Won't the room be cleaned tomorrow?

examples.korean: 프로젝트는 팀에 의해 완료될 거예요.
examples.english: The project will be finished by the team.

examples.korean: 프로젝트는 팀에 의해 완료되지 않을 거예요.
examples.english: The project won't be finished by the team.

examples.korean: 프로젝트가 팀에 의해 완료될 거야?
examples.english: Will the project be finished by the team?

examples.korean: 프로젝트가 팀에 의해 완료되지 않을 거야?
examples.english: Won't the project be finished by the team?

examples.korean: 설거지는 저녁 식사 후에 될 거예요.
examples.english: The dishes will be washed after dinner.

examples.korean: 설거지는 저녁 식사 후에 되지 않을 거예요.
examples.english: The dishes won't be washed after dinner.

examples.korean: 설거지가 저녁 식사 후에 될 거야?
examples.english: Will the dishes be washed after dinner?

examples.korean: 설거지가 저녁 식사 후에 되지 않을 거야?
examples.english: Won't the dishes be washed after dinner?

examples.korean: 이메일은 나중에 나에 의해 보내질 거예요.
examples.english: The email will be sent by me later.

examples.korean: 이메일은 나중에 나에 의해 보내지지 않을 거예요.
examples.english: The email won't be sent by me later.

examples.korean: 이메일이 나중에 나에 의해 보내질 거야?
examples.english: Will the email be sent by me later?

examples.korean: 이메일이 나중에 나에 의해 보내지지 않을 거야?
examples.english: Won't the email be sent by me later?

topics.subtitle: 현재 진행
topics.explanation: 현재 진행 중인 행동을 표현할 때 사용 (Form: is/are being + past participle)

examples.korean: 방은 지금 청소되고 있어요.
examples.english: The room is being cleaned right now.

examples.korean: 방은 지금 청소되고 있지 않아요.
examples.english: The room isn't being cleaned right now.

examples.korean: 방이 지금 청소되고 있어?
examples.english: Is the room being cleaned right now?

examples.korean: 방이 지금 청소되고 있지 않아?
examples.english: Isn't the room being cleaned right now?

examples.korean: 집은 이번 주에 페인트칠되고 있어요.
examples.english: The house is being painted this week.

examples.korean: 집은 이번 주에 페인트칠되고 있지 않아요.
examples.english: The house isn't being painted this week.

examples.korean: 집이 이번 주에 페인트칠되고 있어?
examples.english: Is the house being painted this week?

examples.korean: 집이 이번 주에 페인트칠되고 있지 않아?
examples.english: Isn't the house being painted this week?

examples.korean: 음식은 지금 아빠에 의해 요리되고 있어요.
examples.english: The food is being cooked by my dad.

examples.korean: 음식은 지금 아빠에 의해 요리되고 있지 않아요.
examples.english: The food isn't being cooked by my dad.

examples.korean: 음식이 지금 아빠에 의해 요리되고 있어?
examples.english: Is the food being cooked by my dad?

examples.korean: 음식이 지금 아빠에 의해 요리되고 있지 않아?
examples.english: Isn't the food being cooked by my dad?

examples.korean: 보고서는 지금 팀에 의해 작성되고 있어요.
examples.english: The report is being written by the team.

examples.korean: 보고서는 지금 팀에 의해 작성되고 있지 않아요.
examples.english: The report isn't being written by the team.

examples.korean: 보고서가 지금 팀에 의해 작성되고 있어?
examples.english: Is the report being written by the team?

examples.korean: 보고서가 지금 팀에 의해 작성되고 있지 않아?
examples.english: Isn't the report being written by the team?

topics.subtitle: 과거 진행
topics.explanation: 과거 특정 시점에 진행 중이던 행동을 표현할 때 사용 (Form: was/were being + past participle)

examples.korean: 내가 도착했을 때 방이 청소되고 있었어요.
examples.english: The room was being cleaned when I arrived.

examples.korean: 내가 도착했을 때 방이 청소되고 있지 않았어요.
examples.english: The room wasn't being cleaned when I arrived.

examples.korean: 내가 도착했을 때 방이 청소되고 있었어?
examples.english: Was the room being cleaned when I arrived?

examples.korean: 내가 도착했을 때 방이 청소되고 있지 않았어?
examples.english: Wasn't the room being cleaned when I arrived?

examples.korean: 차는 하루 종일 수리되고 있었어요.
examples.english: The car was being repaired all day.

examples.korean: 차는 하루 종일 수리되고 있지 않았어요.
examples.english: The car wasn't being repaired all day.

examples.korean: 차가 하루 종일 수리되고 있었어?
examples.english: Was the car being repaired all day?

examples.korean: 차가 하루 종일 수리되고 있지 않았어?
examples.english: Wasn't the car being repaired all day?

examples.korean: 그때 합창단에 의해 노래가 불리고 있었어요.
examples.english: The song was being sung by the choir then.

examples.korean: 그때 합창단에 의해 노래가 불리고 있지 않았어요.
examples.english: The song wasn't being sung by the choir then.

examples.korean: 그때 합창단에 의해 노래가 불리고 있었어?
examples.english: Was the song being sung by the choir then?

examples.korean: 그때 합창단에 의해 노래가 불리고 있지 않았어?
examples.english: Wasn't the song being sung by the choir then?

examples.korean: 그때 설거지가 되고 있었어요.
examples.english: The dishes were being washed at that time.

examples.korean: 그때 설거지가 되고 있지 않았어요.
examples.english: The dishes weren't being washed at that time.

examples.korean: 그때 설거지가 되고 있었어?
examples.english: Were the dishes being washed at that time?

examples.korean: 그때 설거지가 되고 있지 않았어?
examples.english: Weren't the dishes being washed at that time?

topics.subtitle: 현재 완료
topics.explanation: 과거부터 현재까지 완료된 행동을 표현할 때 사용 (Form: have/has been + past participle)

examples.korean: 방은 방금 청소됐어요.
examples.english: The room has just been cleaned.

examples.korean: 방은 방금 청소되지 않았어요.
examples.english: The room hasn't just been cleaned.

examples.korean: 방이 방금 청소됐어?
examples.english: Has the room just been cleaned?

examples.korean: 방이 방금 청소되지 않았어?
examples.english: Hasn't the room just been cleaned?

examples.korean: 그 책은 많은 사람들에 의해 읽혔어요.
examples.english: The book has been read by many people.

examples.korean: 그 책은 많은 사람들에 의해 읽히지 않았어요.
examples.english: The book hasn't been read by many people.

examples.korean: 그 책이 많은 사람들에 의해 읽혔어?
examples.english: Has the book been read by many people?

examples.korean: 그 책이 많은 사람들에 의해 읽히지 않았어?
examples.english: Hasn't the book been read by many people?

examples.korean: 바닥은 오늘 아침에 닦였어요.
examples.english: The floor has been mopped this morning.

examples.korean: 바닥은 오늘 아침에 닦이지 않았어요.
examples.english: The floor hasn't been mopped this morning.

examples.korean: 바닥이 오늘 아침에 닦였어?
examples.english: Has the floor been mopped this morning?

examples.korean: 바닥이 오늘 아침에 닦이지 않았어?
examples.english: Hasn't the floor been mopped this morning?

examples.korean: 편지는 친구에 의해 보내졌어요.
examples.english: The letter has been sent by my friend.

examples.korean: 편지는 친구에 의해 보내지지 않았어요.
examples.english: The letter hasn't been sent by my friend.

examples.korean: 편지가 친구에 의해 보내졌어?
examples.english: Has the letter been sent by my friend?

examples.korean: 편지가 친구에 의해 보내지지 않았어?
examples.english: Hasn't the letter been sent by my friend?

topics.subtitle: 과거 완료
topics.explanation: 과거 특정 시점 이전에 완료된 행동을 표현할 때 사용 (Form: had been + past participle)

examples.korean: 파티 전에 방이 청소돼 있었어요.
examples.english: The room had been cleaned before the party.

examples.korean: 파티 전에 방이 청소돼 있지 않았어요.
examples.english: The room hadn't been cleaned before the party.

examples.korean: 파티 전에 방이 청소돼 있었어?
examples.english: Had the room been cleaned before the party?

examples.korean: 파티 전에 방이 청소돼 있지 않았어?
examples.english: Hadn't the room been cleaned before the party?

examples.korean: 아이들이 숙제를 끝내 놓았었어요.
examples.english: The homework had been finished by the kids.

examples.korean: 아이들이 숙제를 끝내 놓지 않았었어요.
examples.english: The homework hadn't been finished by the kids.

examples.korean: 아이들이 숙제를 끝내 놓았었어?
examples.english: Had the homework been finished by the kids?

examples.korean: 아이들이 숙제를 끝내 놓지 않았었어?
examples.english: Hadn't the homework been finished by the kids?

examples.korean: 우리가 도착하기 전에 케이크가 먹혀 있었어요.
examples.english: The cake had been eaten before we arrived.

examples.korean: 우리가 도착하기 전에 케이크가 먹혀 있지 않았어요.
examples.english: The cake hadn't been eaten before we arrived.

examples.korean: 우리가 도착하기 전에 케이크가 먹혀 있었어?
examples.english: Had the cake been eaten before we arrived?

examples.korean: 우리가 도착하기 전에 케이크가 먹혀 있지 않았어?
examples.english: Hadn't the cake been eaten before we arrived?

examples.korean: 여행 전에 차가 고쳐져 있었어요.
examples.english: The car had been fixed before the trip.

examples.korean: 여행 전에 차가 고쳐져 있지 않았어요.
examples.english: The car hadn't been fixed before the trip.

examples.korean: 여행 전에 차가 고쳐져 있었어?
examples.english: Had the car been fixed before the trip?

examples.korean: 여행 전에 차가 고쳐져 있지 않았어?
examples.english: Hadn't the car been fixed before the trip?

topics.subtitle: 미래 완료
topics.explanation: 미래 특정 시점까지 완료될 행동을 표현할 때 사용 (Form: will have been + past participle)

examples.korean: 내일까지 방이 청소돼 있을 거예요.
examples.english: The room will have been cleaned by tomorrow.

examples.korean: 내일까지 방이 청소돼 있지 않을 거예요.
examples.english: The room won't have been cleaned by tomorrow.

examples.korean: 내일까지 방이 청소돼 있을 거야?
examples.english: Will the room have been cleaned by tomorrow?

examples.korean: 내일까지 방이 청소돼 있지 않을 거야?
examples.english: Won't the room have been cleaned by tomorrow?

examples.korean: 다음 주까지 프로젝트가 팀에 의해 완료돼 있을 거예요.
examples.english: The project will have been finished by the team by next week.

examples.korean: 다음 주까지 프로젝트가 팀에 의해 완료돼 있지 않을 거예요.
examples.english: The project won't have been finished by the team by next week.

examples.korean: 다음 주까지 프로젝트가 팀에 의해 완료돼 있을 거야?
examples.english: Will the project have been finished by the team by next week?

examples.korean: 다음 주까지 프로젝트가 팀에 의해 완료돼 있지 않을 거야?
examples.english: Won't the project have been finished by the team by next week?

examples.korean: 오늘 밤까지 설거지가 돼 있을 거예요.
examples.english: The dishes will have been washed by tonight.

examples.korean: 오늘 밤까지 설거지가 돼 있지 않을 거예요.
examples.english: The dishes won't have been washed by tonight.

examples.korean: 오늘 밤까지 설거지가 돼 있을 거야?
examples.english: Will the dishes have been washed by tonight?

examples.korean: 오늘 밤까지 설거지가 돼 있지 않을 거야?
examples.english: Won't the dishes have been washed by tonight?

examples.korean: 정오까지 이메일이 보내져 있을 거예요.
examples.english: The email will have been sent by noon.

examples.korean: 정오까지 이메일이 보내져 있지 않을 거예요.
examples.english: The email won't have been sent by noon.

examples.korean: 정오까지 이메일이 보내져 있을 거야?
examples.english: Will the email have been sent by noon?

examples.korean: 정오까지 이메일이 보내져 있지 않을 거야?
examples.english: Won't the email have been sent by noon?
